meanings.definition: Coadys (noun): A plural form of the word 'coady', referring to a group of people with the surname Coady.
meanings.sent1: The Coadys gathered for a family reunion.
meanings.sent2: I met the Coadys at the party last night.
meanings.sent3: The Coadys decided to have a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: The Coadys were like a flock of birds, always together.
meanings.sent5: The Coadys' surname united them as a close-knit group.

meanings.definition: Coadys (verb): The third person singular form of the verb 'coady', meaning to act in a deceitful or underhanded manner.
meanings.sent1: He coadys when he thinks no one is watching.
meanings.sent2: She coadys to get what she wants.
meanings.sent3: The cat coadys its way into getting extra treats.
meanings.sent4: The politician coadys to gain more votes.
meanings.sent5: The fox coadys its prey with sly tactics.
